rename.from: Use log returns in barrier_touched function?
rename.to: Function barrier_touched compares log returns (ret) to normal returns (target)?

body:
Hi @quoctuams, 

Thanks for highlighting this. The reason we take the log of the returns is to create position symmetry between long and short positions. If your short and price drops 2% you would have made an amount of profit slightly different to that. Taking the log of returns solves that problem. 

The bug your raising here should be corrected and should be a relatively to easy fix. Would you mind to please make a PR for this?

The reason we left this in the past is that the marginal difference between the target and log target should be very small, this does, of course, result in slightly different labels. It should be fixed.

> The reason we left this in the past is that the marginal difference between the target and log target should be very small, this does, of course, result in slightly different labels. It should be fixed.

Thanks for clarifying. In my case the investment horizon is in weeks rather than days so the difference in target and log target turned out to be quite large, leading to some events mislabeled. 

> The bug your raising here should be corrected and should be a relatively to easy fix. Would you mind to please make a PR for this?

The fix should be to log transform the target to compare with log returns, then output the normal target along with normal returns. I'm not familiar with how PR works but will try to see what I can do this weekend. Thanks :)

> The fix should be to log transform the target to compare with log returns, then output the normal target along with normal returns. I'm not familiar with how PR works but will try to see what I can do this weekend. Thanks :)

Great, thank you very much! Ping us if you need help.

I think the following line of code would correct this? 

Original
```
pt_level_reached = ret > target * events.loc[date_time, 'pt']
sl_level_reached = ret < -target * events.loc[date_time, 'sl']
```

New
```
pt_level_reached = ret > np.log(1 + target) * events.loc[date_time, 'pt']
sl_level_reached = ret < -np.log(1 + target) * events.loc[date_time, 'sl']
```

I have this problem too. Here us my output table from get_bins function:


ret             | trgt          | bin | side
0.006406  | 0.005344 | 1    | -1.0
0.005716  | 0.005504 | 1    | -1.0
0.013032  | 0.005164 | 1    | -1.0
-0.019153 | 0.009673 | 0    | -1.0
-0.021063 | 0.009941 | 0    | -1.0

You can see in the 4th row that "ret" is lower than "trgt", which means bin should be -1, am I right? I think this also changes the result of the notebook in research repo:  https://github.com/hudson-and-thames/research/blob/master/Chapter3/2019-03-06_JJ_Trend-Follow-Question.ipynb

Bin only takes values [0,1], with 0 means you should not take that bet. So
in this case your results look fine to me.

The original bug only appears when the target is big enough that the normal
returns and log returns differ significantly. Sorry I havent got time to
make a PR to fix it. Perhaps someone else familiar with how PR works can
help? The fix is quite easy tbh :(

On Mon, Mar 16, 2020 at 3:36 PM Mislav Sagovac <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> I have this problem too. Here us my output table from get_bins function:
>
> ret | trgt | bin | side
> 0.006406 | 0.005344 | 1 | -1.0
> 0.005716 | 0.005504 | 1 | -1.0
> 0.013032 | 0.005164 | 1 | -1.0
> -0.019153 | 0.009673 | 0 | -1.0
> -0.021063 | 0.009941 | 0 | -1.0
>
> You can see in the 4th row that "ret" is lower than "trgt", which means
> bin should be -1, am I right? I think this also changes the result of the
> notebook in research repo:
> https://github.com/hudson-and-thames/research/blob/master/Chapter3/2019-03-06_JJ_Trend-Follow-Question.ipynb
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/hudson-and-thames/mlfinlab/issues/201#issuecomment-599409322>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ADTAFY5GFB62SNACZDMYHHTRHXQI7ANCNFSM4KX2LKAQ>
> .
>

I thought it should be 1 and -1, but this is only if I omit side argument. I get it now :)

I changed above code in fork, but wait for my other pull request to be accepted (if it would be). I will than add change you and @Jackal08 proposed.

Great thank you!

On Mon, Mar 16, 2020 at 4:00 PM Mislav Sagovac <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

issue.title: Change pandas loc with reindex to make function useable with pandas 1.0.

repository.name: mlfinlab
repository.description: MlFinLab helps portfolio managers and traders who want to leverage the power of machine learning by providing reproducible, interpretable, and easy to use tools.

issue.body:
# Description

Repeting request #222 :
A minor change that makes get_events usable with a new version of pandas (and old)

Fixes # (issue)

## Type of change

Please delete options that are not relevant.

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

# How Has This Been Tested?

Using existing test:

-test_labels.py

Test Configuration:

    Windows
    VS code



# Checklist:

- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules
